title: How to Clean Countertops with Natural Products

steps.headline: Make up a solution of vinegar and water.
steps.description: Make the mixture one part vinegar to one part water.

steps.headline: Use a reusable cloth, preferably cotton, to wipe down the countertops.
Rinse out the cloth in a quick burst of hot water after use.
steps.description: If possible, hang outdoors or in direct sunlight to disinfect the cloth after use.

steps.headline: Make a paste from baking soda to eliminate stubborn stains.
steps.description: Such stains include coffee rings, dried on food and drink spills that are very sticky.

steps.headline: Combine three parts baking soda with one part water to make the paste.
Apply the baking soda paste with a damp cloth, lightly dampened recycled paper towel or even with your fingers.
steps.description: Allow it to sit for an hour or two so that it can work on the stubborn stain.

steps.headline: Remove with a damp cloth.
steps.description: Rinse the surface of the counter with a fresh cloth, as there will be a residue left after removing it. It is harmless but a little rough to touch if you do not wipe it off completely.

text: For Everyday Cleaning Make up a solution of vinegar and water. Make the mixture one part vinegar to one part water. Use a reusable cloth, preferably cotton, to wipe down the countertops.  Rinse out the cloth in a quick burst of hot water after use. If possible, hang outdoors or in direct sunlight to disinfect the cloth after use. Stubborn Stains Make a paste from baking soda to eliminate stubborn stains. Such stains include coffee rings, dried on food and drink spills that are very sticky. Combine three parts baking soda with one part water to make the paste.  Apply the baking soda paste with a damp cloth, lightly dampened recycled paper towel or even with your fingers. Allow it to sit for an hour or two so that it can work on the stubborn stain. Remove with a damp cloth. Rinse the surface of the counter with a fresh cloth, as there will be a residue left after removing it. It is harmless but a little rough to touch if you do not wipe it off completely.
